concept.title: License
concept.shortdesc: The DITA for Publishers project is released under the Apache License V2.0

conbody.p: The dita-d4p-classic theme, delivered with the html5 plugin uses additional libraries that are released under the GPL and MIT licenses.

The architecture of the plugin allows you to substitute other libraries if you prefer. For more information, refer to the developer section.need link to the "developer section." In that section, a brief explanation of each library and how it is used would be helpful.

section.title: Foundation
section.p: Foundation is available under the MIT license.
Foundation provides a framework for responsive web design. This simplifies adaptive content styling for different devices and window sizes.

section.title: jQuery
section.p: jQuery is released under the MIT license.

section.title: jQuery UI
section.p: The jQuery UI library is currently available for use in all personal or commercial projects under both MIT and GPL licenses.

section.title: 960 Grid System
section.p: The 960 Grid System is released both under GPL and MIT.

section.title: Modernizr
section.p: Modernizr is available under the MIT license.

section.title: SyntaxHighlighter
section.p: SyntaxHighlighter is currently available for use in all personal or commercial projects under both MIT and GPL licenses.
